artist: Artist: Giovanni Battista Nolli; Engraver: Carlo Nolli; Engraver: Rocco Pozzi; Engraver: Pietro Campana da Sorliano; Designer: Stefano Pozzi
creditline: Gift of Daniel Crouch Rare Books in celebration of the 100th anniversary of the Minneapolis Institute of Art
description: overhead view of city of Rome; bottom right corner has seated female being crowned by a flying putti and accompanied by a youth with a flag and other putti in front of Classical structures; putti to left of seated woman working with surveyors' tools; left of center is a rectangular plaque with text and a putto chiseling a coat of arms; two colossal partially ruined sculpted figures in lower left--seated figure wearing helmet and holding a laurel wreath and reclining male figure with a beard; broken sculptures of dog and youths (?) in LLC; Classical architecture behind; blue edging; black wooden top bracket mount and bottom black wooden scroll bar
dimension:
65 5/8 × 79 7/8 in. (166.69 × 202.88 cm) (image)
70 × 89 1/2 × 1 5/8 in. (177.8 × 227.33 × 4.13 cm) (including top mount and bottom roller)
inscription:
Inscribed in plate mark:
Alla Santita\' Di Nostro Signore Papa Benedetto XIV La Nuova Topografia Di Roma Ossequiosamente Offerisce E Dedica L\'Umilissimo Servo Giambattista Nolli Comasco
Scala di 1000 Palmi Romani d’Architettura
Misurata delin. ed a proprie Spese data in luce da Giambatta Nolli Geom.a ed Arch.o
l’Anno 1748
si stampa in Roma con Privil. del Som.o Pontefice e licenza de Superioriori;
Rocco Pazzi Romano Pietro Campana da Sorliano, e Carlo Nolli inc. 
Stefano Pozzi Pit. inv. e delin.
medium: Etching and engraving on 12 sheets of paper laid down on linen, on original rollers
title: Plan of Rome
